title: Blackened Salmon Fillets Recipe
description: Fire up succulent blackened salmon with an exciting blend of Cajun-style spices, cooked in butter for a flavorful and easy spin on this favorite fish.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Main Dishes Seafood Main Dishes Salmon Salmon Fillet Recipes Blackened Salmon Fillets 4.7 (1,219) 892 Reviews 157 Photos Fire up succulent blackened salmon fillets with an exciting blend of Cajun spices in less than 30 minutes! Submitted by JEFF CALKINS Updated on March 5, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 157 157 157 157 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons ground paprika 1 tablespoon ground cayenne pepper 1 tablespoon onion powder 2 teaspoons salt ¬Ω teaspoon ground white pepper ¬Ω teaspoon ground black pepper ¬º teaspoon dried thyme ¬º teaspoon dried basil ¬º teaspoon dried oregano 4 salmon fillets, skin and bones removed ¬Ω cup unsalted butter, melted Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix paprika, cayenne pepper, onion powder, salt, white and black pepper, thyme, basil, and oregano together in a small bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Brush salmon fillets on both sides with 1/4 cup butter, and sprinkle evenly with the spice mixture. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat 2 tablespoons melted butter in a large, heavy skillet over high heat. Add salmon and cook until blackened, 2 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Lift fillets, add remaining melted butter to the skillet, and flip fillets into the butter. Cook until the other side is blackened and fish flakes easily with a fork, 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,604 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 511 Calories 38g Fat 5g Carbs 37g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 511 % Daily Value * Total Fat 38g 49% Saturated Fat 17g 86% Cholesterol 166mg 55% Sodium 1248mg 54% Total Carbohydrate 5g 2% Dietary Fiber 2g 7% Total Sugars 1g Protein 37g 75% Vitamin C 4mg 4% Calcium 38mg 3% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 802mg 17% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Blackened Salmon Fillets 01 of 157 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 157 Photo by¬† ArtsyHerb5483 01/01/2025 Crowd-pleaser A keeper! Easy to follow It was delicious! I cooked to salmon filets to 125 degrees and they were perfect. Served with homemade sour dough bread with rosemary, feta and Greek olives and Mediterranean salad. It was our New Years Eve dinner with friends. 03 of 157 Photo by¬† nicolekrystyn 01/18/2024 This was an easy and delicious recipe! It really did blacken quickly, which I think was mostly due to the butter browning quickly on high heat. I think I may try to use a high heat oil next time I make this to lessen the smoke and burning smell. The spice blend was really tasty and the salmon paired perfectly with a caesar salad. My husband and I both really enjoyed this recipe and I'll be making it again! 04 of 157 Photo by¬† PuffyCurd6216 11/12/2023 Easy-peasy. Tasted great. Served it with rice recipe I made and a baked potato ü•î. So delicious üòã. Thank you for sharing this recipe. 05 of 157 Photo by¬† NJAccountant 11/05/2023 Perfect recipe. I did not add any salt. I used poultry seasoning as I did not have any thyme or sage. Turned out perfectly. You got me looking like a chef over here. 06 of 157 Photo by¬† Tobie Bryan 03/13/2023 Absolutely delicious! I added garlic and 1 tsp of salt to the seasonings and only used half of the butter called for as I had 3 pieces of salmon instead of four, and had seasoning left over. I served it with jasmine rice with parsley and sauteed peppers and onions. It was awesome! 07 of 157 Photo by¬† bradysddale 08/30/2022 Great, quick and tasty recipe! I love the spice. 08 of 157 Photo by¬† poolgamer 05/18/2022 I scaled back on the peppers a little, but everything else went so well. My family and I loved it... 09 of 157 Photo by¬† Chesty Puller 04/13/2022 Outstanding recipe! I cooked it in my cast iron skillet and did not get it blackened as i hoped but it was delicious! I baked the red potatoes with olive oil and Weber's garlic/parmesan seasoning, and added broccoli with a dash of cheese!!! 10 of 157 Photo by¬† mel 08/01/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Cajun Air Fryer Salmon 53 Ratings Cardamom Maple Salmon 65 Ratings Pan-Fried Salmon with Cream-Dill Sauce 8 Ratings Grilled Salmon Fillets with a Lemon, Tarragon, and Garlic Sauce 108 Ratings Baked Salmon Fillets Dijon 1,571 Ratings Lemon Garlic Salmon 125 Ratings Pan-Fried Salmon in Curry Cream Sauce 20 Ratings Meyer Lemon Cream Sauce for Salmon 10 Ratings Pan-Poached Alaskan Salmon Piccata 147 Ratings Pan Seared Salmon II 38 Ratings Mediterranean-Twist Salmon 20 Ratings Lemon-Garlic Air Fryer Salmon 22 Ratings Pan-Seared Salmon 273 Ratings Easy 5-Ingredient Salmon 658 Ratings Steamed Salmon with Olives and Capers 2 Ratings Blackened Fish 286 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Heat 2 tablespoons melted butter in a large, heavy skillet over high heat. Add salmon and cook until blackened, 2 to 5 minutes.
